channel.title: Nintendo DS Emulator
channel.description:
This Emulator lets you download Nintendo DS games and play them on your PC.
You can download it from the bottom of this post.
You can also download Nintendo-DS-Games from [url=http://www.Nintendo-DS-Roms.com]THIS WEBSITE![/url]
I use this at school on the Laptop Issued to you.
It will lag frequently but it is cool all around.

item.title: Nintendo DS Emulator
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

[offtopic]

Jordan7:

Meh, I’m not going to download but there is also SNES Emulator that comes with 500+ games about 15 Porno games, 200+Sports games and about 300+ other games… I will try to find a link to it

i have it attached as a torrent if you need it…comes with 785 snes games and like 10 porno games…comes with an snes emu if you need it…you just need to rename it back to a torrent file instead of a text file…(mitb wouldn’t let me upload it as a torrent)

[/offtopic]

nds emulators are really crappy right now. i don’t even test them cause of that reason… instead, i just bought a ds and it was like a million times better than en emulator that can get messed up and its hard to work with cause the mouse is not a pencil, its a bulky ovalish item…

P.S. those snes games work on snes emulators that work on the ds…just depends what game you chose to play and what its chipset is… some games like super mario kart snes are a high performance games. they had some special chips in the game kart that made the snes have extra ram and such. thats why that game was able to be played and it was so laggy…

Read full topic

item.title: Nintendo DS Emulator
item.dc:creator: @Wolfeyes217 Wolfeyes217
item.description:
@Wolfeyes217 wrote:

Yeah I downloaded it but did not post because its junk. NDS Emulators don’t work good because of the way the DS works. It will ALWAYS be laggy no matter what kind of computer you have. It also depends on the game you play. And NDS emulators have been out since the NDS came out its self. I have been in NDS hacking community’s along time and I know nearly everything about why the NDS emulators don’t work correctly. And no I am not going to explain why because it is simply to much

Read full topic
